xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Ensure TLS 1.0 is disabled

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: The PCI Data Security Standard 3.1 recommends disabling "early TLS" along with SSL:
SSL and early TLS are not considered strong cryptography and cannot be used as a security control after June 30, 2016.

controls:safeguard.title: Encrypt All Sensitive Information Over Less-trusted Networks

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: This item is Not Scored for the following reasons:

xhtml:ul.xhtml:li: Enabling TLS 1.2 is recommended.
These protocols do not suffer from known practical attacks.

xhtml:p.xhtml:p: Set the following registry locations to configure TLS 1.0. To disable, set Enabled to 0.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Ensure TLS 1.1 is enabled

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Enabling TLS 1.1 is required for backward compatibility.

controls:safeguard.title: Encrypt All Sensitive Information Over Less-trusted Networks

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: This item is Not Scored for the following reasons:

xhtml:ul.xhtml:li: Enabling TLS 1.2 is recommended.
This protocol does not suffer from known practical attacks.

xhtml:p.xhtml:p: Set the following registry locations to enable TLS 1.1. Set Enabled to 1.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Ensure TLS 1.2 is enabled

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: TLS 1.2 is the most recent and mature protocol for protecting the confidentiality and integrity of HTTP traffic. Enabling TLS 1.2 is recommended. This protocol is enabled by default if the registry key is not present. As with any registry changes, a reboot is required for changes to take effect.

controls:safeguard.title: Encrypt All Sensitive Information Over Less-trusted Networks

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: Enabling this protocol will help ensure the confidentiality and integrity of data in transit.

xhtml:p.xhtml:p: Perform the following to enable TLS 1.2:

xhtml:ol.xhtml:li: Check to see if the following key exists. If it doesn't, TLS 1.2 is enabled by default. If it does, you can delete it or follow step 2.
If the key exists, set the following key to 0xFFFFFFFF

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Ensure NULL Cipher Suites is disabled

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: The NULL cipher does not provide data confidentiality or integrity. It is recommended that the NULL cipher be disabled.

controls:safeguard.title: Encrypt All Sensitive Information Over Less-trusted Networks

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: By disabling the NULL cipher, there is a better chance of maintaining data confidentiality and integrity.

xhtml:p.xhtml:p:
To disable the NULL
cipher, ensure the following key is absent. If the key is present, ensure it is set to 0
.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Ensure DES Cipher Suites is disabled

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: DES is a weak symmetric-key cipher. It is recommended that it be disabled.

controls:safeguard.title: Encrypt All Sensitive Information Over Less-trusted Networks

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: By disabling DES, there is a better chance of maintaining data confidentiality and integrity.

xhtml:p.xhtml:p:
To disable DES 56/56
, ensure the following key is absent. If the key is present, ensure it is set to 0
.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Ensure RC4 Cipher Suites is disabled

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: RC4 is a stream cipher that has known practical attacks. It is recommended that RC4 be disabled. The only RC4 cipher enabled by default on Server 2012 and 2012 R2 is RC4 128/128.

controls:safeguard.title: Encrypt All Sensitive Information Over Less-trusted Networks

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: The use of RC4 may increase an adversaries ability to read sensitive information sent over SSL/TLS.

xhtml:p.xhtml:p:
To disable RC4 40/128
, ensure the following key is absent. If the key is present, ensure it is set to 0
.

To disable RC4 56/128
, ensure the following key is absent. If the key is present, ensure it is set to 0
.

To disable RC4 64/128
, ensure the following key is absent. If the key is present, ensure it is set to 0
.

To disable RC4 128/128
, ensure the following key is set to 0
.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Ensure Triple DES Cipher Suite is Disabled

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Triple DES Cipher Suites is now considered a weak cipher and is not recommended for use.

controls:safeguard.title: Encrypt All Sensitive Information Over Less-trusted Networks

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: This item is Not Scored for the following reasons:

xhtml:ul.xhtml:li: Enabling AES 256/256 is recommended.
This cipher does not suffer from known practical attacks.

xhtml:p.xhtml:p:
To disable Triple DES 168/168
, ensure the following key is set to 00000000
.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Ensure AES 128/128 Cipher Suite is configured

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Enabling AES 128/128 may be required for client compatibility. Enable or disable this cipher suite accordingly.

controls:safeguard.title: Encrypt All Sensitive Information Over Less-trusted Networks

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: This item is Not Scored for the following reasons:

xhtml:ul.xhtml:li: Enabling AES 256/256 is recommended.
This cipher does not suffer from known practical attacks.

xhtml:p.xhtml:p:
To enable the AES 128/128
cipher, ensure the following key is set to 0xFFFFFFFF
:

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Ensure AES 256/256 Cipher Suite is enabled

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: AES 256/256 is the most recent and mature cipher suite for protecting the confidentiality and integrity of HTTP traffic. Enabling AES 256/256 is recommended. This is enabled by default on Server 2012 and 2012 R2.

controls:safeguard.title: Encrypt All Sensitive Information Over Less-trusted Networks

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: Enabling this cipher will help ensure the confidentiality and integrity of data in transit.

xhtml:p.xhtml:p:
To enable the AES 256/256
cipher:

xhtml:ol.xhtml:li: Ensure that the following key does not exist. If it does exist, you can either delete the key or proceed to step 2.

If the key exists, ensure the following is set to 0x FFFFFFFF
.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Ensure TLS Cipher Suite ordering is configured

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Cipher suites are a named combination of authentication, encryption, message authentication code, and key exchange algorithms used for the security settings of a network connection using TLS protocol. Clients send a cipher list and a list of ciphers that it supports in order of preference to a server. The server then replies with the cipher suite that it selects from the client cipher suite list.

controls:safeguard.title: Encrypt All Sensitive Information Over Less-trusted Networks

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: Cipher suites should be ordered from strongest to weakest in order to ensure that the more secure configuration is used for encryption between the server and client.
TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA384
TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256
TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA384
TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256
Avoid cipher suits that do not provide Perfect Forward Secrecy or use weak hashing function, use them only if you need to support backwards compatibility and in the bottom of the list:
TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA (uses SHA-1)
TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA (uses SHA-1)
TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA (uses SHA-1)
TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA (uses SHA-1)
TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384 (lack of Perfect Forward Secrecy)
TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256 (lack of Perfect Forward Secrecy)
TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA256 (lack of Perfect Forward Secrecy)
TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256 (lack of Perfect Forward Secrecy)
TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA (uses SHA-1, lack of Perfect Forward Secrecy)
TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA (uses SHA-1, lack of Perfect Forward Secrecy)

Note:
HTTP/2 compatibility: first 4 ciphers (in bold) in the top part list are compatible with HTTP/2

xhtml:p.xhtml:p: To establish the recommended configuration via registry setting, set the following registry key path to and confirm it is set as prescribed.
OR

To establish the recommended configuration via GP, set the following UI path to Enabled:TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384,TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256,TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384,TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256,TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA384,TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256,TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA384,TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256
xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Network\SSL Configuration Settings\SSL Cipher Suite Order
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: This group policy setting is backed by the following registry:
Add backward compatibility ciphers as needed:
Impact:
Cipher ordering is important to ensure that the most secure ciphers are listed first and will be applied over weaker ciphers when possible.
